segment.source: Lockdown features from Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry (Windows 10)
segment.target: Lockdown features from Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry (Windows 10)

segment.source: Many of the lockdown features available in Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry have been modified in some form for Windows 10.
segment.target: Many of the lockdown features available in Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry have been modified in some form for Windows 10.

segment.source: Lockdown features from Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry
segment.target: Lockdown features from Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Many of the lockdown features available in Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry have been modified in some form for Windows 10.
segment.target: Many of the lockdown features available in Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry have been modified in some form for Windows 10.

segment.source: This table maps Windows Embedded Industry 8.1 features to Windows 10 Enterprise features, along with links to documentation.
segment.target: This table maps Windows Embedded Industry 8.1 features to Windows 10 Enterprise features, along with links to documentation.

segment.source: Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry lockdown feature
segment.target: Windows Embedded 8.1 Industry lockdown feature

segment.source: Windows 10 feature
segment.target: Windows 10 feature

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: Hibernate Once/Resume Many (HORM): Quick boot to device
segment.target: Hibernate Once/Resume Many (HORM): Quick boot to device

segment.source: N/A
segment.target: N/A

segment.source: HORM is not supported in Windows 10.
segment.target: HORM is not supported in Windows 10.

segment.source: However, with enhancements to the Windows boot process and Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) hardware, startup times can be dramatically reduced compared to previous versions.
segment.target: However, with enhancements to the Windows boot process and Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) hardware, startup times can be dramatically reduced compared to previous versions.

segment.source: Unified Write Filter: protect a device's physical storage media
segment.target: Unified Write Filter: protect a device's physical storage media

segment.source: Unified Writer Filter
segment.target: Unified Writer Filter

segment.source: The Unified Write Filter is continued in Windows 10, with the exception of HORM which has been deprecated.
segment.target: The Unified Write Filter is continued in Windows 10, with the exception of HORM which has been deprecated.

segment.source: Keyboard Filter: block hotkeys and other key combinations
segment.target: Keyboard Filter: block hotkeys and other key combinations

segment.source: Keyboard Filter
segment.target: Keyboard Filter

segment.source: Keyboard filter is added in Windows 10, version 1511.
segment.target: Keyboard filter is added in Windows 10, version 1511.

segment.source: As in Windows Embedded Industry 8.1, Keyboard Filter is an optional component that can be turned on via Turn Windows Features On/Off.
segment.target: As in Windows Embedded Industry 8.1, Keyboard Filter is an optional component that can be turned on via Turn Windows Features On/Off.

segment.source: Keyboard Filter (in addition to the WMI configuration previously available) will be configurable through Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) in the SMISettings path.
segment.target: Keyboard Filter (in addition to the WMI configuration previously available) will be configurable through Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) in the SMISettings path.

segment.source: Shell Launcher: launch a Classic Windows application on sign-on
segment.target: Shell Launcher: launch a Classic Windows application on sign-on

segment.source: Shell Launcher
segment.target: Shell Launcher

segment.source: Shell Launcher continues in Windows 10.
segment.target: Shell Launcher continues in Windows 10.

segment.source: It is now configurable in Windows ICD under the SMISettings category.
segment.target: It is now configurable in Windows ICD under the SMISettings category.

segment.source: Learn how to use Shell Launcher to create a kiosk device that runs a Classic Windows application.
segment.target: Learn how to use Shell Launcher to create a kiosk device that runs a Classic Windows application.

segment.source: Application Launcher: launch a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app on sign-on
segment.target: Application Launcher: launch a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app on sign-on

segment.source: Assigned Access
segment.target: Assigned Access

segment.source: The Windows 8 Application Launcher has been consolidated into Assigned Access.
segment.target: The Windows 8 Application Launcher has been consolidated into Assigned Access.

segment.source: Application Launcher enabled launching a Windows 8 app and holding focus on that app.
segment.target: Application Launcher enabled launching a Windows 8 app and holding focus on that app.

segment.source: Assigned Access offers a more robust solution for ensuring that apps retain focus.
segment.target: Assigned Access offers a more robust solution for ensuring that apps retain focus.

segment.source: Dialog Filter: suppress system dialogs and control which processes can run
segment.target: Dialog Filter: suppress system dialogs and control which processes can run

segment.source: AppLocker
segment.target: AppLocker

segment.source: Dialog Filter has been deprecated for Windows 10.
segment.target: Dialog Filter has been deprecated for Windows 10.

segment.source: Dialog Filter provided two capabilities; the ability to control which processes were able to run, and the ability to prevent dialogs (in practice, system dialogs) from appearing.
segment.target: Dialog Filter provided two capabilities; the ability to control which processes were able to run, and the ability to prevent dialogs (in practice, system dialogs) from appearing.

segment.source: Control over which processes are able to run will now be provided by AppLocker.
segment.target: Control over which processes are able to run will now be provided by AppLocker.

segment.source: System dialogs in Windows 10 have been replaced with system toasts.
segment.target: System dialogs in Windows 10 have been replaced with system toasts.

segment.source: To see more on blocking system toasts, see Toast Notification Filter below.
segment.target: To see more on blocking system toasts, see Toast Notification Filter below.

segment.source: Toast Notification Filter: suppress toast notifications
segment.target: Toast Notification Filter: suppress toast notifications

segment.source: Mobile device management (MDM) and Group Policy
segment.target: Mobile device management (MDM) and Group Policy

segment.source: Toast Notification Filter has been replaced by MDM and Group Policy settings for blocking the individual components of non-critical system toasts that may appear.
segment.target: Toast Notification Filter has been replaced by MDM and Group Policy settings for blocking the individual components of non-critical system toasts that may appear.

segment.source: For example, to prevent a toast from appearing when a USB drive is connected, ensure that USB connections have been blocked using the USB-related policies, and turn off notifications from apps.
segment.target: For example, to prevent a toast from appearing when a USB drive is connected, ensure that USB connections have been blocked using the USB-related policies, and turn off notifications from apps.

segment.source: Group Policy: User ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesStart Menu and TaskbarNotifications
segment.target: Group Policy: User ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesStart Menu and TaskbarNotifications

segment.source: MDM policy name may vary depending on your MDM service.
segment.target: MDM policy name may vary depending on your MDM service.

segment.source: In Microsoft Intune, use Allow action center notifications and a custom OMA-URI setting for AboveLock/AllowActionCenterNotifications.
segment.target: In Microsoft Intune, use Allow action center notifications and a custom OMA-URI setting for AboveLock/AllowActionCenterNotifications.

segment.source: Embedded Lockdown Manager: configure lockdown features
segment.target: Embedded Lockdown Manager: configure lockdown features

segment.source: Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD)
segment.target: Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD)

segment.source: The Embedded Lockdown Manager has been deprecated for Windows 10 and replaced by the Windows ICD.
segment.target: The Embedded Lockdown Manager has been deprecated for Windows 10 and replaced by the Windows ICD.

segment.source: Windows ICD is the consolidated tool for Windows imaging and provisioning scenarios and enables configuration of all Windows settings, including the lockdown features previously configurable through Embedded Lockdown Manager.
segment.target: Windows ICD is the consolidated tool for Windows imaging and provisioning scenarios and enables configuration of all Windows settings, including the lockdown features previously configurable through Embedded Lockdown Manager.

segment.source: USB Filter: restrict USB devices and peripherals on system
segment.target: USB Filter: restrict USB devices and peripherals on system

segment.source: MDM and Group Policy
segment.target: MDM and Group Policy

segment.source: The USB Filter driver has been replaced by MDM and Group Policy settings for blocking the connection of USB devices.
segment.target: The USB Filter driver has been replaced by MDM and Group Policy settings for blocking the connection of USB devices.

segment.source: Group Policy: Computer ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesSystemDevice InstallationDevice Installation Restrictions
segment.target: Group Policy: Computer ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesSystemDevice InstallationDevice Installation Restrictions

segment.source: MDM policy name may vary depending on your MDM service.
segment.target: MDM policy name may vary depending on your MDM service.

segment.source: In Microsoft Intune, use Allow removable storage or Allow USB connection (Windows 10 Mobile only).
segment.target: In Microsoft Intune, use Allow removable storage or Allow USB connection (Windows 10 Mobile only).

segment.source: Assigned Access: launch a UWP app on sign-in and lock access to system
segment.target: Assigned Access: launch a UWP app on sign-in and lock access to system

segment.source: Assigned Access
segment.target: Assigned Access

segment.source: Assigned Access has undergone significant improvement for Windows 10.
segment.target: Assigned Access has undergone significant improvement for Windows 10.

segment.source: In Windows 8.1, Assigned Access blocked system hotkeys and edge gestures, and non-critical system notifications, but it also applied some of these limitations to other accounts on the device.
segment.target: In Windows 8.1, Assigned Access blocked system hotkeys and edge gestures, and non-critical system notifications, but it also applied some of these limitations to other accounts on the device.

segment.source: In Windows 10, Assigned Access no longer affects accounts other than the one being locked down.
segment.target: In Windows 10, Assigned Access no longer affects accounts other than the one being locked down.

segment.source: Assigned Access now restricts access to other apps or system components by locking the device when the selected user account logs in and launching the designated app above the lock screen, ensuring that no unintended functionality can be accessed.
segment.target: Assigned Access now restricts access to other apps or system components by locking the device when the selected user account logs in and launching the designated app above the lock screen, ensuring that no unintended functionality can be accessed.

segment.source: Learn how to use Assigned Access to create a kiosk device that runs a Universal Windows app.
segment.target: Learn how to use Assigned Access to create a kiosk device that runs a Universal Windows app.

segment.source: Gesture Filter: block swipes from top, left, and right edges of screen
segment.target: Gesture Filter: block swipes from top, left, and right edges of screen

segment.source: Assigned Access
segment.target: Assigned Access

segment.source: The capabilities of Gesture Filter have been consolidated into Assigned Access for Windows 10.
segment.target: The capabilities of Gesture Filter have been consolidated into Assigned Access for Windows 10.

segment.source: In Windows 8.1, gestures provided the ability to close an app, to switch apps, and to reach the Charms.
segment.target: In Windows 8.1, gestures provided the ability to close an app, to switch apps, and to reach the Charms.

segment.source: For Windows 10, Charms have been removed, and blocking the closing or switching of apps is part of Assigned Access.
segment.target: For Windows 10, Charms have been removed, and blocking the closing or switching of apps is part of Assigned Access.

segment.source: Custom Logon: suppress Windows UI elements during Windows sign-on, sign-off, and shutdown
segment.target: Custom Logon: suppress Windows UI elements during Windows sign-on, sign-off, and shutdown

segment.source: Embedded Logon
segment.target: Embedded Logon

segment.source: No changes.
segment.target: No changes.

segment.source: Applies only to Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education.
segment.target: Applies only to Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education.

segment.source: Unbranded Boot: custom brand a device by removing or replacing Windows boot UI elements
segment.target: Unbranded Boot: custom brand a device by removing or replacing Windows boot UI elements

segment.source: Unbranded Boot
segment.target: Unbranded Boot

segment.source: No changes.
segment.target: No changes.

segment.source: Applies only to Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education.
segment.target: Applies only to Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education.
